languages.label: Languages
languages.description: List of languages used on you computer

osCpu.label: OS CPU
osCpu.description: Identification string for your current operating system.

canvas.label: Canvas fingerprint
canvas.description: Two images are drawn inside of your browser with the help of html canvas. Rendering images can be different on different computers, due to differences in hardware and software. Thats why this is a good method to distinguish devices.

audio.label: Audio fingerprint
audio.description: The audio fingerprint uses the Web Audio API to sample a sound. Differences in hardware can lead to different sampling values. This is a good way to distinguish between different devices.

domBlockers.label: Dom Blockers
domBlockers.description: Checks for common content blockers in the browser.

fontPreferences.label: Font Preferences
fontPreferences.description: Renders a text in different fonts and measures the width.

colorDepth.label: Color Depth
colorDepth.description: A number, representing the bit depth of the color palette for displaying images.

deviceMemory.label: Device Memory
deviceMemory.description: Approximate amount of decive memory in gigabytes.

screenResolution.label: Screen Resolution
screenResolution.description: Value of the users screen resolution.

hardwareConcurrency.label: Hardware Concurrency
hardwareConcurrency.description: Number of logical processors available to your browser. Represents how many processes can be run in parallel.

sessionStorage.label: Session Storage
sessionStorage.description: Checks if the session storage api is available.

localStorage.label: Local Storage
localStorage.description: Checks if the local storage api is available.

indexedDB.label: Indexed DB
indexedDB.description: Checks if the indexed DB api is available.

openDatabase.label: Open Database
openDatabase.description: Checks if the open database api is available.

platform.label: Platform
platform.description: Platform on which your browser is running.

touchSupport.label: Touch Support
touchSupport.description: Checks if the users device supports touch.

vendor.label: Vendor
vendor.description: Returns the vendor of the browser (only works for apple and google).

cookiesEnabled.label: Cookies Enabled
cookiesEnabled.description: Checks if you have cookies enabled.

colorGamut.label: Color Gamut
colorGamut.description: Tests which color gamut is supported by your browser.

invertedColors.label: Inverted Colors
invertedColors.description: Tests if you have your computer's colors inverted.

forcedColors.label: Forced Colors
forcedColors.description: Tests if you have a forced color mode activated (e.g. high contrast mode).

monochrome.label: Monochrome
monochrome.description: Check if your display is monochrome (e.g. black & white).

contrast.label: Contrast
contrast.description: Tests if you prefer more or less color contrast.

reducedMotion.label: Reduced Motion
reducedMotion.description: Tests if you prefer a reduced motion mode.

hdr.label: HDR
hdr.description: Tests if your device supports high dynamic range (hdr).

math.label: Math
math.description: Checks the value of different math functions like sin or cos

pdfViewerEnabled.label: PDF Viewer Enabled
pdfViewerEnabled.description: Cheks if the pdf viewser is enabled.

architecture.label: Architecture
architecture.description: Distinguishes if you computer has a x86/x86-64 or another architecture.

applePay.label: Apple Pay
applePay.description: Checks if you browser supports Apple Pay, and if it is enabled.

privateClickMeasurement.label: Private Click Measurement
privateClickMeasurement.description: Checks if the Pricacy Perserving Ad Measurement setting is on. (Only works in Safari)

audioBaseLatency.label: Audio Base Latency
audioBaseLatency.description: Tests the base latency for you browsers audio context (part of the Web Audio API, only tests for Safari and on Android)

webGlBasics.label: webGL Basics
webGlBasics.description: Checks for webGL hardware and software configurations.
